definition: Han Dynasty term for the Roman Empire 羅馬帝國|罗马帝国[Luo2 ma3 Di4 guo2]
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
surname Qin/Qin dynasty (221-207 BC) of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]/abbr. for 陝西|陕西[Shan3 xi1]

sentences.english: With my HanShaoGong daqin let come in, they shout a game.
sentences.chinese: 大秦讓韓紹功跟本人進來，兩人大喝一場。

sentences.english: The Qin Empire describes the rise and fall of the Qin Empire.
sentences.chinese: 《大秦帝國》寫的是秦帝國崛起興亡的故事。

definition: Han Chinese name for an ancient Central Asia country
the imperial court/the government in imperial times
the Tang dynasty (618-907)

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
sage ruler
Sino-Turkish
Hualong district of Puyang city 濮陽市|濮阳市[Pu2 yang2 shi4], Henan
North of Xinjiang
Eastern Barbarians, non-Han tribe living to the east of China c 2200 BC
(slang) (Tw) Taipei 臺北|台北[Tai2 bei3]
to found a country
to unify/unified
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
Western Qin of the Sixteen Kingdoms (385-431)
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Anxi county, former name of Guazhou county 瓜州縣|瓜州县[Gua1 zhou1 xian4] in Jiuquan 酒泉[Jiu3 quan2], Gansu
